name: Flowboard
tagline: Project management built for remote-first teams
description:
Flowboard reimagines project management with async-first workflows designed for distributed teams. No more standup meetings ‚Äî everything happens through structured updates, smart digests, and a timeline that keeps everyone aligned without the noise of traditional tools.

Built by a team that spent years frustrated by Jira and Asana, Flowboard focuses on outcomes over activity. It integrates with Slack, GitHub, and Linear, and ships with a mobile app that actually works.

name: Verdant
tagline: Carbon tracking for modern supply chains
description:
Verdant gives businesses a real-time view of their carbon footprint across the entire supply chain. With integrations into 100+ logistics platforms and ERP systems, it turns compliance into a competitive advantage.

Already deployed at 40+ mid-market companies across Europe. Verdant's reporting is audit-ready, automating what used to take sustainability teams months to produce manually.

name: Luma Health
description:
Luma pairs wearable sensors with AI-driven insights to help individuals and employers catch health issues before they escalate. The platform reduces missed diagnoses and cuts healthcare costs by up to 40% in early pilots.

Luma's B2B2C model sells to self-insured employers and health systems, who offer it as a benefit to employees. Currently in three pilot programmes with regional hospital networks.

name: Cartex
description:
Cartex provides card-issuing, ledgering, and compliance APIs so non-finance companies can embed financial products in days, not months. Already powering over 20 fintech products across three continents.

Their developer-first approach means a working prototype in under an hour. Full PCI-DSS compliance, real-time fraud scoring, and a dashboard built for ops teams ‚Äî not just engineers.

name: Orion AI
description:
Orion deploys fine-tuned language models on-premise or in private cloud environments, giving enterprises the power of AI without exposing sensitive data to third parties.

Focused on legal, finance, and healthcare verticals. Orion's models are trained on domain-specific corpora and augmented with customer data via secure RAG pipelines. No data leaves the customer's environment.

name: Nomadly
description:
Nomadly connects remote workers with verified co-living spaces globally, offering flexible monthly stays, community matching, and a built-in visa concierge. Think furnished apartments meets professional community.

Over 1,200 verified rooms across 35 cities. Members get access to a global network of co-working desks, curated events, and a visa advisory team for navigating digital nomad visas.

name: LaunchPad Studio
tagline: Branding & web design for early-stage startups
description:
LaunchPad Studio specialises in helping early-stage startups build brand identity from scratch ‚Äî logo, design system, landing page, and pitch deck ‚Äî in under three weeks. Flat-rate packages, no retainers.

Their process is built around founder collaboration. Week one is discovery, week two is execution, week three is refinement and handoff. Everything is Figma-native and developer-ready.

name: Growthfile
tagline: SEO and content for B2B SaaS startups
description:
Growthfile is a content marketing agency focused exclusively on B2B SaaS. They handle keyword strategy, long-form content, and distribution ‚Äî with transparent ROI tracking built into every engagement.

Every piece of content is mapped to pipeline, not just traffic. Clients see monthly reports showing MQL attribution, keyword rank movement, and conversion benchmarks against similar companies.

name: Stackform
tagline: Fractional CTO services for non-technical founders
description:
Stackform provides experienced technical leadership on a part-time basis. They help founders make smart architecture decisions, hire the right engineers, and ship v1 without burning runway on avoidable mistakes.

Typically engaged 2 days per week, Stackform CTOs join your Slack, attend key meetings, review PRs, and own the technical roadmap. Clients have raised over $40M combined after working with Stackform.

name: Legup
description:
Legup has distilled the most common startup legal needs into clear, fixed-fee packages: incorporation, founder agreements, SAFE notes, employment contracts, and NDAs. No billable hours, no surprises.

Founded by ex-BigLaw attorneys who were tired of seeing founders overpay for basic legal work. Legup handles over 300 startups annually and has a turnaround SLA of 48 hours on standard documents.

name: Raise Capital
tagline: Investor intro network for pre-seed founders
description:
Raise Capital curates warm intros to over 400 angel investors and micro-VCs. Founders submit a deck, go through a short screening call, and get matched with relevant investors within 5 business days.

No upfront fee. Raise Capital takes a small success fee only if you close funding from an intro they made. Average check size from their network is $150K‚Äì$500K.

name: Hirecraft
description:
Hirecraft places senior engineers, product managers, and designers exclusively at early-stage startups. Every candidate is vetted for startup fit, not just skills. Success-fee model ‚Äî no placement, no charge.

Their vetting process includes a culture calibration interview, a practical assignment, and a reference check. Hirecraft's average time-to-offer is 18 days vs. the industry average of 45.

name: The Fundraising Playbook
tagline: A tactical guide to raising your first round
description:
A step-by-step guide covering everything from building your investor list and crafting your narrative to managing a process and closing. Includes real templates for first emails, follow-ups, and data room structure.

Written by a founder who raised $2.4M pre-seed and $8M seed, this guide shares the exact process, tools, and scripts used ‚Äî not generic advice.

name: YC's Essential Startup Advice
description:
Y Combinator has published its most essential principles for building a startup: how to find product-market fit, how to talk to users, when to hire, and how to avoid the most common fatal mistakes.

Highly referenced across the startup world. Recommended reading before writing a single line of code or making your first hire.

name: Notion for Startups
description:
A curated set of Notion templates specifically built for startup teams: product roadmap, hiring tracker, OKR system, investor CRM, and board meeting notes. Duplicate and run in minutes.

Used by 50,000+ startups. The investor CRM template alone has saved founders hundreds of hours managing their fundraising pipeline.

name: First Round Review
tagline: In-depth essays on building products that last
description:
First Round Capital's editorial arm publishes long-form essays with real operators: engineering leads, product founders, and executives sharing hard-won lessons on hiring, culture, product, and scale.

Unlike most startup content, First Round Review goes deep. Articles average 4,000+ words with specific, actionable advice from named practitioners.

name: Stripe Atlas Guides
description:
Stripe Atlas offers a comprehensive collection of guides on incorporating in the US, setting up business banking, understanding equity structures, and navigating tax obligations ‚Äî written for international founders.

Covers Delaware C-Corps, SAFE agreements, cap table management, and the practicalities of operating as a global startup with a US entity.

name: Lenny's Newsletter
tagline: Practical product and growth advice, weekly
description:
Lenny Rachitsky's newsletter covers product strategy, growth tactics, and career advice for PMs and founders. Backed by surveys of hundreds of product leaders, each issue is packed with benchmarks and actionable frameworks.

One of the most read newsletters in tech ‚Äî relevant whether you're building your first product or scaling a team.
